import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.314b31ae:
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(25, 25))
plt.subplots_adjust(wspace=0.4, hspace=0.6)
for i, col in enumerate(df.columns):
    ax = plt.subplot2grid((3, 3),(i//3, i%3))
    sns.histplot(df[col], ax=ax)
    ax.set_title(col)
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)

source.4064277a:
Next, I tried to find what features are most important.
* Writing is most important to improve math skill. Next one is Reading skill. And enough prepararion for test is also important.
* Group E has the highest positive correlation with not only math score but also writing score and reading score. It has also has highest positive correlation with lunch_standard and test preparation than any other groups. The difference among Groups may cause education gap.
source.705af68c:
Mathematics is one of the very important skills to be data scientist. So I tried to find how I can improve my math skill to be nice data scientist.

First, I compared the regression models and found that Linear Regression seem to be best for prediction, R2 0.87 in train, 0.88 in test.
source.8ddb1371:
If I could be grown up in Group E, I might have advantage in math skill. But actually, it is impossible, because I am already 54 years old and live in Japan.....

What can I do now ? Is it too late ?

I found the interesting article 'Connecting Math and Science to Reading and Writing'
https://www.edutopia.org/article/connecting-math-and-science-reading-and-writing

In the article, I found good instructions.

# “The explosion of online information of varying quality means that good citizenship now hinges on being able to analyze a tsunami of statistics, graphics, and numbers—both to test competing claims, and to advance new solutions and ideas in the civic space.”
# By weaving together civics or social studies and math, students get used to working through complex arguments using the finer points of these disciplines.

I think that Connecting math to Reading and Writing will make my skill more practical.
